trans-unit.source: When a domain name is sent to Zonemaster for testing, Zonemaster investigates the state of the domain name from the top to the bottom of the DNS tree. This is usually done by examining DNS data from the root, '.', to the Top-Level Domain (TLD) for that domain name, like '.net', and then finally through the DNS servers that contain authoritative information about the specified domain name.
trans-unit.target: When a domain name is sent to Zonemaster for testing, Zonemaster investigates the state of the domain name from the top to the bottom of the DNS tree. This is usually done by examining DNS data from the root, '.', to the Top-Level Domain (TLD) for that domain name, like '.net', and then finally through the DNS servers that contain authoritative information about the specified domain name.

trans-unit.source: The name of nameserver is required
trans-unit.target: The name of nameserver is required

trans-unit.source: Check how your domain is doing
trans-unit.target: Check how your domain is doing

trans-unit.source: The Domain Name System (DNS) is a database that associates domain names to Internet Protocol (IP) addresses, the same way a phone book associates names to phone numbers. An IP address is a unique series of numbers that identifies every computer that is connected to the Internet. It is similar to the way every telephone has its own number in the telephone network. Such long series of numbers work fine for computers, but for people it is way more difficult to memorize. Thus, the DNS has been developed as an extra layer to map between names that we can remember better and IP addresses used by computers whenever we want to reach a specific website or use other services on the Internet, like e-mail.
trans-unit.target: The Domain Name System (DNS) is a database that associates domain names to Internet Protocol (IP) addresses, the same way a phone book associates names to phone numbers. An IP address is a unique series of numbers that identifies every computer that is connected to the Internet. It is similar to the way every telephone has its own number in the telephone network. Such long series of numbers work fine for computers, but for people it is way more difficult to memorize. Thus, the DNS has been developed as an extra layer to map between names that we can remember better and IP addresses used by computers whenever we want to reach a specific website or use other services on the Internet, like e-mail.

trans-unit.source: Can I test the DS records before they are published?
trans-unit.target: Can I test the DS records before they are published?

trans-unit.source: What makes Zonemaster different from other DNS zone validating software?
trans-unit.target: What makes Zonemaster different from other DNS zone validating software?

trans-unit.source: To check a reverse zone with Zonemaster, one first needs to know what the reverse zone is, and enter it in the format it has in the DNS. A reserve zone is obtained by reversing an IP address and adding a suffix. IPv4 addresses use the suffix "in-addr.arpa" while IPv6 addresses use "ip6.arpa".
trans-unit.target: To check a reverse zone with Zonemaster, one first needs to know what the reverse zone is, and enter it in the format it has in the DNS. A reserve zone is obtained by reversing an IP address and adding a suffix. IPv4 addresses use the suffix "in-addr.arpa" while IPv6 addresses use "ip6.arpa".

trans-unit.source: The ambition of the Zonemaster project is to develop and maintain an open source DNS validation tool, offering improved performance over existing tools and providing extensive documentation which could be re-used by similar projects in the future.
trans-unit.target: The ambition of the Zonemaster project is to develop and maintain an open source DNS validation tool, offering improved performance over existing tools and providing extensive documentation which could be re-used by similar projects in the future.

trans-unit.source: Yes. If DNSSEC is available for a domain name that is tested by Zonemaster, it will be checked automatically.
trans-unit.target: Yes. If DNSSEC is available for a domain name that is tested by Zonemaster, it will be checked automatically.

trans-unit.source: CLI,a command-line interface to the Engine;
trans-unit.target: CLI,a command-line interface to the Engine;

trans-unit.source: Nothing beside the test domain, other test parameters and the result is stored in the database. Specifically we do not store any information that could link a test to the user who initiated it.
trans-unit.target: Nothing beside the test domain, other test parameters and the result is stored in the database. Specifically we do not store any information that could link a test to the user who initiated it.

trans-unit.source: How can Zonemaster distinguish between what is right and wrong?
trans-unit.target: How can Zonemaster distinguish between what is right and wrong?

trans-unit.source: The components will help different types of users to check domain servers for configuration errors and generate a report that will assist in fixing the errors.
trans-unit.target: The components will help different types of users to check domain servers for configuration errors and generate a report that will assist in fixing the errors.

trans-unit.source: The judgement of Zonemaster is primarily based on the DNS standards as defined in RFCs. It also bases its judgement on DNS best practices, which can be more loosely defined.
trans-unit.target: The judgement of Zonemaster is primarily based on the DNS standards as defined in RFCs. It also bases its judgement on DNS best practices, which can be more loosely defined.

trans-unit.source: This can be quite useful if one is going to migrate one's domain from one registrar to another, for example, migrate zone 'example.com' from the name server 'ns.example.com' to the name server 'ns.example.org'. In this scenario one could perform an undelegated domain test providing the zone ('example.com') and the name server you are migrating to ('ns.example.org') before you migrate your domain. When the results of the test doesn't show any errors or warnings one can be fairly certain that the domain's new location is working well. However there might still be other problems in the zone data itself that this test is unaware of.
trans-unit.target: This can be quite useful if one is going to migrate one's domain from one registrar to another, for example, migrate zone 'example.com' from the name server 'ns.example.com' to the name server 'ns.example.org'. In this scenario one could perform an undelegated domain test providing the zone ('example.com') and the name server you are migrating to ('ns.example.org') before you migrate your domain. When the results of the test doesn't show any errors or warnings one can be fairly certain that the domain's new location is working well. However there might still be other problems in the zone data itself that this test is unaware of.

trans-unit.source: Zonemaster can be used to test DS records before their publication in the parent zone.
trans-unit.target: Zonemaster can be used to test DS records before their publication in the parent zone.

trans-unit.source: GUI, a web interface to the Backend.
trans-unit.target: GUI, a web interface to the Backend.

trans-unit.source: Zonemaster send multiple DNS queries to the name servers hosting the domain name being tested and also to the name servers hosting the parent zone of that domain name.
trans-unit.target: Zonemaster send multiple DNS queries to the name servers hosting the domain name being tested and also to the name servers hosting the parent zone of that domain name.

trans-unit.target: You can also get further insight about each test from the Test Case Specification documents.

trans-unit.source: This open source version of Zonemaster was built using modular code which basically means that you can integrate parts of it in your own systems, if you wish. For example, it is quite rare that you would want a complete program just to check for redelegations.
trans-unit.target: This open source version of Zonemaster was built using modular code which basically means that you can integrate parts of it in your own systems, if you wish. For example, it is quite rare that you would want a complete program just to check for redelegations.

trans-unit.source: Zonemaster can only test what is called a DNS zone, for example 'zonemaster.net', and not host names, like 'www.zonemaster.net'.
trans-unit.target: Zonemaster can only test what is called a DNS zone, for example 'zonemaster.net', and not host names, like 'www.zonemaster.net'.

trans-unit.source: Queries sent can be shown using the 'DEBUG' level option. Fair warning, the output from the CLI can be quite heavy. For more information see CLI usage documentation.

trans-unit.source: Zonemaster consists of several modules or components:
trans-unit.target: Zonemaster consists of several modules or components:

trans-unit.source: An undelegated domain test is a test performed on a domain name that may, or may not, be fully published in the DNS.
trans-unit.target: An undelegated domain test is a test performed on a domain name that may, or may not, be fully published in the DNS.

trans-unit.source: Bakend, a server that allows you to run Zonemaster tests and save results using a JSON-RPC API and a database;
trans-unit.target: Bakend, a server that allows you to run Zonemaster tests and save results using a JSON-RPC API and a database;

trans-unit.source: DNS operators, experts and beginners alike, who want to check their DNS configuration;
trans-unit.target: DNS operators, experts and beginners alike, who want to check their DNS configuration;

trans-unit.source: All Zonemaster tests are defined in the Test Case Specification documents in which the references to the standard documents for that test case are found.
trans-unit.target: All Zonemaster tests are defined in the Test Case Specification documents in which the references to the standard documents for that test case are found.

trans-unit.source: Zonemaster performs many tests, such as checking DNSSEC signatures, or that different hosts can be accessed and that IP addresses are valid. This is all to make sure that your domain name runs as smoothly as possible.
trans-unit.target: Zonemaster performs many tests, such as checking DNSSEC signatures, or that different hosts can be accessed and that IP addresses are valid. This is all to make sure that your domain name runs as smoothly as possible.

trans-unit.source: The web interface of Zonemaster does not show the queries that were sent, only the CLI interface can. If you want to see such queries, you will have to locally install a minimally working Zonemaster instance with both the Engine and CLI components. See the CLI installation document for more information, or if you prefer a Docker image is also available.
trans-unit.target: The web interface of Zonemaster does not show the queries that were sent, only the CLI interface can. If you want to see such queries, you will have to locally install a minimally working Zonemaster instance with both the Engine and CLI components. See the CLI installation document for more information, or if you prefer a Docker image is also available.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes there are different interpretations of the standards or opinions on what is best practice, and the Zonemaster team is always open to input. If you think we have made a mistake in our judgement please do not hesitate to send us an email at zonemaster-users@lists.iis.se (moderated mailing list) with a link to your test result and an explanation as to why you think it shows something that you consider incorrect.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes there are different interpretations of the standards or opinions on what is best practice, and the Zonemaster team is always open to input. If you think we have made a mistake in our judgement please do not hesitate to send us an email at zonemaster-users@lists.iis.se (moderated mailing list) with a link to your test result and an explanation as to why you think it shows something that you consider incorrect.

trans-unit.source: users who want to know whether the domain name they own or use have any issues or not.

trans-unit.source: However, since zonemaster.net, like other public instances, is open to everyone, it is possible for anyone to test your domain and view its history of tests.
trans-unit.target: However, since zonemaster.net, like other public instances, is open to everyone, it is possible for anyone to test your domain and view its history of tests.

trans-unit.source: Zonemaster saves all history from earlier tests based on the tested domain name, which means you can go back to a test you did some time ago and compare it to the test you ran just a moment ago.
trans-unit.target: Zonemaster saves all history from earlier tests based on the tested domain name, which means you can go back to a test you did some time ago and compare it to the test you ran just a moment ago.

trans-unit.source: You still don't find the information you are looking for? You can contact the Zonemaster project team using the user mailing list, the issue tracker or the contact e-mail address.
trans-unit.target: You still don't find the information you are looking for? You can contact the Zonemaster project team using the user mailing list, the issue tracker or the contact e-mail address.

trans-unit.source: Engine, a test framework that supports all functionality to perform DNS tests;
trans-unit.target: Engine, a test framework that supports all functionality to perform DNS tests;

trans-unit.source: It depends on which test failed for your domain name. Each test is accompanied with one or several messages describing the issues found.
trans-unit.target: It depends on which test failed for your domain name. Each test is accompanied with one or several messages describing the issues found.

trans-unit.source: Zonemaster is a software package that validates the quality of a DNS delegation.
trans-unit.target: Zonemaster is a software package that validates the quality of a DNS delegation.

trans-unit.source: There is a 10 minutes protection between consecutive tests for a given domain name, with same test parameters. Running a test within that window will instead show the last available test for that domain name, and parameters.
trans-unit.target: There is a 10 minutes protection between consecutive tests for a given domain name, with same test parameters. Running a test within that window will instead show the last available test for that domain name, and parameters.

trans-unit.source: Yes. By default Zonemaster will query name servers both over IPv4 and IPv6, unless explicitly configured otherwise. Such configuration is accessible through the "Options" button.
trans-unit.target: Yes. By default Zonemaster will query name servers both over IPv4 and IPv6, unless explicitly configured otherwise. Such configuration is accessible through the "Options" button.

trans-unit.source: Zonemaster can be used to test undelegated domain names.
trans-unit.target: Zonemaster can be used to test undelegated domain names.

trans-unit.source: Zonemaster is a joint project between AFNIC, the registry of '.fr' TLD and several other TLDs like '.re', '.pm', '.tf', '.wf', '.yt' and '.paris', and The Swedish Internet Foundation, the registry of '.se' and '.nu' TLDs.
trans-unit.target: Zonemaster is a joint project between AFNIC, the registry of '.fr' TLD and several other TLDs like '.re', '.pm', '.tf', '.wf', '.yt' and '.paris', and The Swedish Internet Foundation, the registry of '.se' and '.nu' TLDs.

trans-unit.target: The descriptions of message levels such as notice, warning and error are found in Severity Level Definitions.

trans-unit.source: Yes. Use the "Options" button and there add the Delegation Signer (DS) records to be tested. Zonemaster will then use those in the same way as if they were already added in the parent zone.
trans-unit.target: Yes. Use the "Options" button and there add the Delegation Signer (DS) records to be tested. Zonemaster will then use those in the same way as if they were already added in the parent zone.

trans-unit.note: Currently selected slide number read by screen reader

trans-unit.source: The message means something that should be known by the zone's administrator but that need not necessarily be a problem at all.
trans-unit.target: The message means something that should be known by the zone's administrator but that need not necessarily be a problem at all.

trans-unit.source: The message is something that may be of interest to the zone's administrator but that definitely does not indicate a problem.
trans-unit.target: The message is something that may be of interest to the zone's administrator but that definitely does not indicate a problem.

trans-unit.source: The message means something that will under some circumstances be a problem, but that is unlikely to be noticed by a casual user.
trans-unit.target: The message means something that will under some circumstances be a problem, but that is unlikely to be noticed by a casual user.

trans-unit.source: What is the meaning of the severity levels?
trans-unit.target: What is the meaning of the severity levels?

trans-unit.source: The message means a problem that is very likely (or possibly certain) to negatively affect the function of the zone being tested, but not so severe that the entire zone becomes unresolvable.
trans-unit.target: The message means a problem that is very likely (or possibly certain) to negatively affect the function of the zone being tested, but not so severe that the entire zone becomes unresolvable.

trans-unit.source: The message means a very serious error.
trans-unit.target: The message means a very serious error.
